ðŸ‡µðŸ‡± RafaÅ‚ Brzozowski to represent Poland at Eurovision 2021 with "The Ride"
The Polish broadcaster TVP has announced that RafaÅ‚ Brzozowski will represent Poland at the Eurovision Song Contest 2021 with the song “The Ride”!
Listen to “The Ride”
RafaÅ‚ Brzozowski might be a familiar name for some Eurovision fans already. In 2017, he took part in Poland’s national selection with “Sky Over Europe” and finished second behind the winner Kasia MoÅ›. In 2020 RafaÅ‚ hosted the Junior Eurovision Song Contest in Poland. He also was one of the jury members of the Eurovision Song Contest 2019. His favourite was Australia’s “Zero Gravity”.
Last year Poland was set to be represented by Alicja SzempliÅ„ska, who won their national selection Szansa na sukces with her song “Empires”. After the contest was cancelled, Alicja expressed her desire to represent Poland in 2021.
Poland at the Eurovision Song Contest
Poland first debuted Eurovision in 1994, with the fabulous Edyta GÃ³rniak and her â€˜To nie ja!â€™. To this day, that remains as Polandâ€™s best ever placing in Eurovision, with them only reaching the top 10 twice since then (most recently in 2016 with MichaÅ‚ Szpak and â€˜Color of Your Lifeâ€™).
Between 2005 and 2011, we only saw Poland in one Eurovision grand final â€“ in 2008 with Isis Gee and â€˜For Lifeâ€™. In the last three years, Poland has again failed to qualify for the final â€“ in 2019, Tulia missed out by only three points.
Will you support Poland at Eurovision 2021? Let us know! Be sure to stay updated by following @ESCXTRA on Twitter, @escxtra on Instagram and liking our Facebook page for the latest updates! Also, be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel to see our reactions to the news in the upcoming months.
